ygData.subject: Re: Level 30,35,40,45, and a "power level" comme
ygData.msgSnippet: That is such a great story.  I ve always loved RPing (D&D and stuff not that.. get your mind out of the gutter...) with women but it is so rare.  Would have
ygData.messageBody:
That is such a great story. I've always loved RPing (D&D and stuff
not that.. get your mind out of the gutter...) with women but it is so
rare. Would have loved to sit in on some of your sessions.

Bujold 17th level
(Hair in the same condition as yours and that's all I'll say as well.)


______________________________ Reply Separator _________________________________
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Level 30,35,40,45, and a "power level" comme
Author: Non-HP-loraroa (loraroa@...) at HP-ColSprings,mimegw5
Date: 7/16/99 7:15 AM


From: Lora Roa <loraroa@...>

Not quite, but I can add a 4 generation span of
... FRPing women!

My children aren't old enough to give me grandchildren yet ..
but my daughter plays EQ (and played 2 other on-line MMRPG's with
me).

Back in my younger days when I had time to DM/GM, my Grandmother
(who at the time was in her 80's) was a regular member of my
all-female FRP group. The XT had yet to be invented. Though,
I was programming a TRS-80 to do D&D character gen (AD&D hadn't
happened yet either).

My Grandmothers favorite : NG or LG Cleric
My Daughter's: right now a Female Ogre Warrior named Bombom
Hrrmmm .. I'm the Bard. Though a caster/thief hybrid is my
preferred choice, Bard does well.

And I'm going to be the typical female: my hair is going grey, and
that's as close to disclosing my age as I get!

- Lora
( & Christina, and my late Grandmother for whom I was named - Lora)

>Hah! I laugh on your young lapel.
>
>I'm 51, married, and have 2 married sons who between them have 3 kids of
>their own. Both of them play EverQuest, too. Can anyone beat that?
>
>Neither of them wants to play a bard, but it other than old inertia to play
>a dwarf warrior, it was my obvious, enthusiastic choice.
>
> Bob
